english.segment1: I got the call at 2am, it awoke me from my sleep. I didnt recognize the voice, it was nervous and quite deep. He said that she was taken fast, she probably never knew. Maybe he was comforting me, or maybe it was true
english.segment2: The last time that I saw her she was walking out the door. I didnt think to hug her, it was just a trip to the store. Did I say I love you? Did she know it when she died?. When she had her last glance at me, did I look her in the eye?
english.segment3: Though I dont see, I still believe. Theres a purpose. Youre the eye of the storm. We fall asleep but we believe. You will wake us. And Your bride will come home
english.segment4: I took her to a restaurant, she spilled her drink on me. In anger I belittled her, I never said I was sorry. And now its those memories that haunt me in my sleep. How often we love someone, but were just to proud to speak
english.segment5: Though I dont see, I still believe. Theres a purpose. Youre the eye of the storm. We fall asleep but we believe. You will wake us. And Your bride will come home
english.segment6: When I was at the funeral. I tried hard not to cry. I didnt want to grieve like the world. As though the lost had died
english.segment7: Shes my sleeping beauty. For now shes resting in peace. But one day, Redeemer, Redeemer. Youll wake her from her sleep
english.segment8: I did alright till I went in her room. I buckled under the load. Tomorrow if the rain stops. well put a cross on the side of the road
english.segment9: God is good all the time. Even when little girls die
